content.title: Malperfusion Syndromes in Aortic Dissection
content.summary: Malperfusion syndromes are life-threatening complications of aortic dissection where branch vessel compromise leads to end-organ ischemia. They significantly increase mortality and often require urgent endovascular or surgical intervention.
content.definition: End-organ ischemia resulting from compromise of aortic branch vessels during aortic dissection, caused by dynamic or static obstruction of branch vessel flow

epidemiology.mortality_impact: 2-3x higher mortality compared to dissection without malperfusion
epidemiology.timing: Usually present at presentation or develops within first 48 hours

dynamic_obstruction.description: Intimal flap prolapses into branch vessel origin during systole
dynamic_obstruction.characteristics: Fluctuates with hemodynamics, may be positional

static_obstruction.description: Branch arises from false lumen that thromboses or has inadequate inflow

coronary.treatment: Emergent surgical repair Â± coronary bypass/reimplantation

cerebral.prognosis: Poor if complete stroke before repair
cerebral.treatment: Emergent aortic repair, carotid stent if accessible

spinal_cord.treatment: CSF drainage, blood pressure optimization, aortic repair

visceral_mesenteric.mortality: Highest of malperfusion syndromes if untreated
visceral_mesenteric.treatment: Aortic fenestration/stent, branch stenting, surgical exploration

limb.treatment: Iliac/femoral stenting, fenestration, bypass if needed

imaging.TEE: Assesses coronary ostia, may show flap dynamics

type_A_dissection.persistent: Address residually malperfused organs after aortic repair

type_B_dissection.complicated: Malperfusion = complicated Type B, requires intervention

fenestration.description: Creating communication between true and false lumens

branch_stenting.description: Stenting branch vessel into true lumen
branch_stenting.indication: Static obstruction not relieved by aortic treatment

TEVAR_with_entry_coverage.mechanism: Sealing entry tear expands true lumen, relieves obstruction

prognosis.with_treatment: Dependent on organ, timing, extent of damage

definition.@value: End-organ ischemia from branch vessel compromise during aortic dissection

medicalCode.description: Dissection of unspecified site of aorta

learning_objectives: Define malperfusion syndrome and differentiate dynamic from static obstruction
Outline treatment priorities for Type A vs Type B with malperfusion
List endovascular and surgical treatment options
clinical_pearls: Dynamic obstruction: flap prolapses into branch; may fluctuate
Static obstruction: branch from thrombosed false lumen; fixed
Malperfusion = complicated Type B, requires intervention
TEVAR covering entry tear can relieve malperfusion by expanding true lumen
